Title: Drive Thru Cashier - Harvey's - Cornwall, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
HARVEY’S IS LOOKING FOR DRIVE THRU CASHIERS
TO JOIN OUR CORNWALL LOCATION!
MAKE YOUR CAREER A BEAUTIFUL THING AT HARVEY’S
For over 60 years, Harvey’s has been serving great tasting, flame-grilled burgers to Canadians. We are on a journey looking for great people to be part of this iconic 100% Canadian brand that has homegrown roots across the country.
What you will do in this role:
Be a stellar listener and take guests orders, while ensuring 100% accuracy
Handle the dough $$$
Show your love for Harvey’s by being knowledgeable with our menu, personable with our guests and maintaining overall flow of the checkout line
Identify guest’s needs and recommend additional offerings
What we are looking for:
Possess a positive and friendly personality
Demonstrate excellent communication skills
Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced environment
Ability to follow Harvey’s standards, food/ safety regulations, and Health and Safety policies
What’s in it for you:
20% employee discount card valid at participating Recipe brands
Flexible scheduling
A chance to be part of a close knit team
Competitive wages
Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant
Career advancement opportunities in a company that owns some of Canada’s most iconic restaurants brands
If you are passionate about working hard with a fun team that is committed to serving Canadians the best tasting burgers, Harvey's has a future for you! Apply online today.
Some positions may be with our franchise partners, which are independently owned and operated.
Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.
Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact recruit@recipeunlimited.com

Title: Budtender/ Cashier - Hamilton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Looking for experienced budtenders!!
BUDTENDER/CASHIER
Job Posting Description
As advocates of responsible consumption, we are here to educate and build our cannabis
community. Our goal is to provide customers with only the finest products, with our
knowledgeable and personable team to assist with each individual need.
Thank you for your interest in joining our team. All applicants must be the minimum age of 19
with flexible availability with varying shifts including days, evenings and weekends with the
store being open every day. This role will initially be part-time casual with the opportunity to
transition to full-time.
What to expect:
We offer a competitive compensation package while working in an exciting and unique retail
work environment. In joining our team training is continuous in this role for you and the entire
team to provide a great work environment and the best possible customer experience. If you
enjoy a fast-paced work environment are energetic and positive with a can-do attitude towards
customer satisfaction and working in a team environment then Barttowa Tree Ltd. is a place for
you.
Why join us:
Great leadership and a positive inclusive team environment
Cross-training, continual learning and opportunity for growth
Employee recognition programs, performance incentives and social events
Group health benefits available for full-time associates
Requirements and Qualifications:
Pre-employment Criminal Record Check
CannSell Ontario Standard Certificate
Desire and ability to develop a positive in-depth understanding of cannabis
2 years plus experience in a similar scope of role with sales and customer service
experience in retail or hospitality with extensive customer-facing interaction
Ability to diplomatically and professionally interact with customers at all times
Role requires consistent use and access to multiple flights of stairs to interact with
customers throughout a multi-story building
Meet the physical demands of a retail environment including transporting up to 11 kg
Typical responsibilities of the job include:
Engage with customers to understand their needs and educate them on responsible
cannabis use
Provide information based on ongoing learning and accurate product knowledge
Convert customer needs into sales in real-time using tablets for order processing
Cultivate, grow and retain customer base through an exemplary customer experience
Working with team members to fulfill orders and cash out customers
Comprehend, apply, follow and enforce guidelines as required by industry regulations
Barttowa Tree Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed
to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Employment Contract Description
Reports to the Store Manager/Assistant Managers/Shift Managers
Recognize signs of impairment and/or abuse and immediately report this information to
your supervisor
Engage with customers and walk through of the floor
Convey accurate product information to customers
Create order with customer through provided tablet
Hand off customer to cashier
Maintain adequate stock and accurate inventory counts
Cultivate long term-customer relationships by providing superior customer service
Follow guidelines and protocol as required in a highly regulated industry
Budtenders should stay up to date on current strains and products available in the
dispensary
Demonstrable knowledge of cannabis products – various flower strains including future
products (i.e. concentrates, edibles, topicals)
Help maintains the cleanliness of the store
CASHIER
Employment Contract Description
Reports to the Store Manager/Assistant Managers/Shift Managers
Greet customers in a friendly matter
Refuse to provide cannabis to an individual, whom the employee or volunteer believes is
abusing cannabis or appears impaired
Responsible for cash handling at the register, including giving proper change and
counting their registers at the start and close of any shift
Each cashier is assigned their own till. It is not to be shared with other cashiers for the
assigned till is the designated cashier’s responsibility
Manage transactions with customers using cash registers
Scan goods and ensure pricing is accurate
Cashiers should stay up to date on current strains and products available in the dispensary
Collect payment whether in cash, debit, or credit
Issue receipts, refunds & exchanges (must be manager approved),
Cross-sell products and introduce new ones
Resolve customer complaints, guide them and provide relevant information
Maintain clean and tidy checkout area
Track transactions on balance sheet and report any discrepancies
Bag, box or gift-wrap packages
Part-time hours: 10-20 per week
Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Salary: From $34,889.00 per year
Part-time hours: 20-30 per week
Job Type: Part-time
Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour
Part-time hours: 20 per week
Job Type: Part-time
Schedule:
Weekend availability
Work remotely:
No

Title: Retail Cashier - Tyne Valley, PE - Indeed.com
Description:
Murphy Healthcare is in the business of caring—we care about our communities, our clients, and our team members. Our family-owned and operated business has much more to offer than the paycheque alone. We are proud of the impact we have had in our communities for the past forty years. As we work to transform healthcare, delivering exceptional experiences for our clients, we’re looking for a Part-time
Retail Cashier
aligned with our core values of
care, collaboration, and community
to join our
Tyne Valley
location.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive wages
Leadership development program
Discounts with local businesses to help you save money, including home heating oil, restaurants, and island retailers
Subsidized fitness membership
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
You’re a people person who loves to smile
You have an excellent work ethic, proven ability to multi-task and communicate with clients in a pleasant manner.
Your attention to detail is above-average.
You have a passion for providing excellent service.
You’re comfortable and confident working in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple demands.
You’re reliable, efficient, and like being part of a team.
You love the flexibility of shift work.
You have the physical ability to stand for extended periods of time; repetitive hand movements; bending/twisting; lift/move up to 25 pounds
HOW YOU’LL SPEND YOUR TIME
Accurately and efficiently completing all cash register transactions in a courteous, prompt and accurate manner.
Providing knowledgeable client care and customer service with respect to product location, selection and information.
Greeting clients, acknowledging waiting clients, and offering assistance.
Ensuring service is maintained at levels above industry standards.
Demonstrating effective two-way communication with customers, other staff members, and management.
Contributing to promoting a positive, friendly, safe, and healthy environment for all staff and clients.
Maintaining a clean work environment and ensuring shelves are stocked.
Other duties assigned by the Supervisor, as required.
ARE YOU OUR NEXT TEAM MEMBER?
If you are professional, personable, patient, detail-oriented, and have the ability to stay calm in a variety of situations, please submit your cover letter and resume. We appreciate your interest in working with us. You’ll hear from one of our team members if we wish to continue the conversation with an interview.
Murphy Healthcare is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Cashier - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Cashier Team Member
1430 Prince of Wales Drive, Ottawa, Ontario
Part-time/Full-time
Famer’s Pick is a family, locally owned and operated grocery store that has been serving the community for almost 30 years. We provide a unique food shopping experience for our customers and an excellent work environment for our team. The atmosphere is like you’ve just walked into a grocery store in a small town where the owner knows his customers and team members by name. We are on the search to find people that have our vision at heart and are passionate about customer service and hard work. We provide compensation above that of our competitors and we share with our team members, not shareholders.
We provide competitive compensation based on experience, and a great working environment.
If you feel you have what it takes to become a part of our team, we would like to hear from you!
Job Description
Cashier Team Members are the face of our store, and are responsible for processing customer orders. This individual must be personable and always ready and willing to provide customers with a very positive, memorable shopping experience, all while performing their required responsibilities and duties at a high level.
Major Responsibilities
· Provide a superior level of customer service with a friendly caring tone and smile
· Process all customer purchases, collect the accurate tenders and bag the purchased items.
· Handing special request from customers
· Keep the work, storage and store areas clean at all times
· Perform opening and closing procedures
· Must possess the ability to work well with others
Qualifications
· Must demonstrate excellence in friendly, professional customer service
· Good verbal communication skills are required as you will be dealing directly with customers
· You have a keen eye and good attention to detail
· Previous retail food experience would be a definite asset
Availability
· Monday to Friday days
Salary
· $14.50 to $18.00 per hour depending on experience
Part-time hours: 15-40 per week
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Salary: $14.50-$18.00 per hour
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday

No

Title: Switchboard/cashier/admitting Clerk - Cranbrook, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job title
:SWITCHBOARD/CASHIER/ADMITTING CLERK
Community
:CRANBROOK
Facility
:EK REGIONAL HOSPITAL
Status
:CASUAL
Position Summary
East Kootenay Regional Hospital is looking for a Casual Switchboard/Cashier/Admitting Clerk. Apply today!
When you apply, please ensure you include the following documentation for your application to be considered:
A current 5 Minutes Typing Test 45 wpm or greater completed within past 48 months from a recognized institution, (ON-LINE TESTS NOT ACCEPTED);
Your Grade 12 Diploma;
Your Resume indicating two year’s recent related experience, Or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience;
A Cover Letter stating your availability to start in a new position;
Certificates/Diplomas/Transcripts must be from accredited Schools/Colleges/Universities.
This position performs a variety of switchboard, registration and cashier duties, such as:
Processes calls (internal and external) and establishes communication links;
Provides information to customers and assists in relaying messages;
Answers emergency calls and follows established communications procedures in emergency situations;
Maintains Physician paging system and after hours physician’s emergency lines;
Records and organizes data to facilitate the operations of the morgue;
Receives "On-Call" information from physicians and updates data as required;
Receives patient porter requests and dispatches transfers to the patient porter team;
Maintains confidentiality of classified information.
Hours of work: Rotating Monday-Friday: 08:00 to 16:00, 08:00 to 15:00
This is a Casual opportunity. Casual means there are no guaranteed hours and work requirements can vary from 0 - 37.5 hours per week.
Come live, work and play where others only vacation. Make a difference. Love your work. Apply today!
Interior Health strives to create an environment where you enjoy the work you do, the place where you work, and the people around you. Everyone plays a role in the care continuum. Together, we create great workplaces....Be part of a dynamic team!
Come and join us! Our focus is on giving people room to grow, to make an impact in the lives of others.
Qualifications
Education, Training and Experience:
Grade 12,
Two year’s recent related experience, Or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Completion of a 5 minute Typing Test 45 wpm or greater, dated within the past 48 months and must be issued from a valid institution only. (ON-LINE TESTS ARE NOT ACCEPTED)
Skills and Abilities:
Ability to keyboard at 45 w.p.m.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Ability to physically carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
Ability to operate related equipment.
**ONLY QUALIFIED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED.**
**Please Note**
We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.
